intro: Crotalaria leopoldvillensis, commonly known as the Leopoldville crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and bean-like pods. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces clusters of showy, yellow-orange flowers. Crotalaria leopoldvillensis is also known for its potential medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
